isis.stitle: POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD M-SERIES - PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE - INPUT SHAFT SEAL REPLACEMENT BEFORE JULY 1990

svcproc.title: INPUT SHAFT SEAL REPLACEMENT BEFORE JULY 1990

svcprocinfo.para: Production prior to July 1990 - the input bearing cap will not have a grease fitting.

important.para: Do not remove the steering gear for this procedure.

svcprocinfo.para: Before a seal can be replaced, you must identify the manufacturing date of the steering gear. This can be done by following the steering gear identification procedure.

warning.para: Failure to replace all seals, cotter pins, retainers and critical fasteners may result in an accident, injury or death.

step1.para: Park the vehicle on a clean, dry, solid surface, preferably concrete. Set the parking brake and block the wheels. Place the transmission in neutral. Make sure the engine is OFF.
Loosen and remove the pinch bolt on the lower end yoke of the steering shaft.
Remove the lower yoke from the steering gear input shaft. If necessary, secure the steering shaft so it will not be in the way.

important.para: Do not pull the slip shaft out of the steering shaft. This would require re-phasing at time of installation.

step1.para: Place the drain pan under the power steering gear. Draining the system is not necessary, but some fluid will be lost.
Use a ratchet and 15 or 16 mm socket to loosen and remove the 4 bearing cap cover bolts and cover ( Figure 15).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Loosen and Remove Bearing Cap Cover Bolts

caution.para: Do not turn the input shaft during repairs. Turning the shaft or mixing components will cause damage to the bearing cap and actuating shaft assembly.

important.para: The thrust washer may stick to the bearing cap cover. If this happens, re-install the thrust washer in the steering gear ( Figure 16 and Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Re-Install Thrust Washer in Steering Gear
Figure 18. Re-Install Thrust Washer in Steering Gear

step1.para: Discard the cover as a new type will be used.
Removal of the teflon ring and energizer ring from the shaft is optional.
Apply a light coat of white grease or similar substance to the input shaft and install the cover. Make sure the plunger hole lines up.

note.para: The input shaft seal and cover O-ring are installed prior to shipment.

caution.para: Slide the new cover on the shaft slowly to avoid damage to the seal.

step1.para: Install the four (4) 10 x 1.5 mm mounting bolts and tighten to 53 to 63 ft-lbs. (72 to 85 Nm).

Check the instruction sheet with the kit and select the proper diameter salt seal. Slide the salt seal over the shaft and push it into the seal bore with your fingers. Make sure the lip of the seal is facing out ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Make Sure Lip of Seal is Facing Out

step1.para: Re-install the lower yoke of the steering shaft on the steering gear. Make sure the pinch bolt hole in the yoke lines up with the whistle notch on the input shaft.
Install the pinch bolt and nut and tighten. Refer to GROUP 05 - STEERING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the proper torque value for the vehicle and type of column being service.
Use a hand grease gun to pump a small amount of grease into the grease fitting until grease can be seen coming out around the salt seal.
Check the fluid level in the power steering reservoir; make sure it is full.
Clean any fluid from the power steering gear and remove the drain pan.
